Class Utility

java.lang.Object
Utility
public class Utility extends Object
This class has everything needed for colouring the terminal, as well as a function to load the JSON files.

  • Method Details

    • jsonFileReader

      public static javax.json.JsonObject jsonFileReader(javax.json.JsonReader jsReader, javax.json.JsonObject jsObject, String path, String cardType, int index) throws FileNotFoundException
      https://docs.oracle.com/javaee/7/api/javax/json/package-summary.html The JsonParser is what we will use to search using the : - getString('Name of the variable in the JSON file') to store a String - getInt('Name of the variable in the JSON file') to store an Int - ... The search is done in the Unordered Map which is the jsObject that has all name/value pairs.
      Parameters:
      jsReader - :: Reads a JSON object or an array structure from the given file.
      jsObject - :: Store a non modifiable unordered collection of name/value pairs (Map)
      path - :: Path of the JSON file in the project
      cardType - :: Given card type (Goal, Rule, Keeper) upon instantiation
      index - :: Index of the card (Max is total type of card)
      Returns:
      A JSON object parser that will give us the ability to store the data in the JSON files in our private variables.
      Throws:
      FileNotFoundException - In case the files were not found the game will exit.

    • printIntro

      public static void printIntro()
      Prints the introduction of the game.

    • loadingAnimation

      public static void loadingAnimation() throws InterruptedException
      Cool animation before the start of the game.
      Throws:
      InterruptedException - Thread Interruption in case of exiting during the animation
